revised_title: Sorption of Krypton and Xenon in Zeolites: High Pressures and Temperatures
tldr: The authors studied the sorption of krypton and xenon in various zeolites at high pressures and temperatures. They found that chabazite and active carbon were the most efficient sorbents for reducing rare gas pressures in high-temperature, high-pressure systems. The study provides insights into the sorption mechanisms and the role of intracrystalline electrostatic fields in the sorption process.
